name: hunger
content:
hunger noun
(NEED FOR FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ U ] the feeling you have when you need to eat: satisfy your hunger I can't believe that that enormous meal wasn't enough to satisfy your hunger.faint from/with hunger By about nine o'clock she started to feel faint from/with hunger.hunger pangs I often suffer from hunger pangs (= strong feelings of needing something to eat) in the middle of the afternoon.
B2 [ U ] a situation in which the body does not have enough food: die of hunger All over the world, people die of hunger every day.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter three days, we felt an agonizing, gnawing hunger.I don't know why I'm eating more - it's not hunger, it's just greed!We hadn't eaten since yesterday and the hunger pangs were getting harder to ignore.It revolts me to know that the world spends so much money on arms when millions are dying of hunger.Hundreds of refugees collapsed from hunger and thirst.
